New Records: Yordan Alvarez hit three home runs and tied Hall of Fame slugger Jeff Bagwell for most three-homer games in Astros history
Spencer Arrighetti carried a no-hit bid into the eighth inning
Key Match Events: Jose Altuve got Houston on the board in the first inning by stealing home
Arrighetti took over from there, striking out four of the first five Phillies he faced
Houston left fielder Mauricio Dubón kept the no-hit bid alive with a leaping catch of Brandon Marsh’s fly ball against the wall for the final out of the seventh inning
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Joe Espada said Arrighetti was magnificent
Manager Rob Thomson said the Phillies will have to decide whether to run Walker out there for his next start
Post-Match Reflections: Espada said the Astros needed a little spark and Altuve did that
Walker felt like he made progress with a lot of ground balls
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros avoided a three-game sweep while winning for just the third time in nine games
The Phillies have lost Walker's last nine starts
The worst home shutout loss for Phillies since Aug. 10, 2017, a 10-0 loss to the New York Mets
